claim: I was born in 2000 and turned 25 in 2025

supporting.text: If you were born in 2000, your 25th birthday would occur in 2025, as 2000 + 25 = 2025.

attacks.text: If you were born in 2000, your 25th birthday would occur in 2025, as 2000 + 25 = 2025.
This assumes the birthday has already occurred in 2025. If the statement is made before the birthday, the person would still be 24 for part of the year.
The claim specifies 'turned 25 in 2025,' which implies the birthday occurred during the year, resolving the ambiguity.

supporting.text: A person born on January 1, 2000, would turn 25 on January 1, 2025, confirming the claim.

attacks.text: A person born on January 1, 2000, would turn 25 on January 1, 2025, confirming the claim.
The claim does not specify the exact birth date, so if the person was born after January 1, 2000, they would not have turned 25 by 2025.
Even if the birth date is after January 1, the claim could still hold if the person was born early enough in 2000 to turn 25 by the end of 2025.
The claim explicitly states 'turned 25 in 2025,' implying the birthday occurred within the year 2025, not necessarily by January 1.

supporting.text: The Gregorian calendar calculates age by counting full years from the birth year, making 2025 the 25th year since 2000.

attacks.text: The Gregorian calendar calculates age by counting full years from the birth year, making 2025 the 25th year since 2000.
In some cultures, age is counted differently, such as in East Asian traditions where a person is considered 1 year old at birth and gains a year at each Lunar New Year.
The Gregorian calendar is the internationally recognized standard for age calculation, making cultural variations less relevant in most contexts.
If the person was born on December 31, 2000, they would not have completed 25 full years by January 1, 2025, making the claim technically incorrect.
The claim does not specify the exact birth date, so assuming a December 31 birth is an edge case and not representative of the general scenario.

supporting.text: Mathematically, subtracting the birth year (2000) from the current year (2025) yields an age of 25, supporting the claim.

attacks.text: Mathematically, subtracting the birth year (2000) from the current year (2025) yields an age of 25, supporting the claim.
The calculation assumes the birthday has already occurred in 2025. If the person was born after the current date in 2000, they would still be 24 in 2025.
The claim specifies 'turned 25 in 2025,' implying the birthday has occurred within the year, making the age calculation correct.
